findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. Declaring a variable as immutable can reduce storage and computation required by the contract, making it more gas-efficient.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract owner can abuse the mint functionality, leading to high inflation.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The contract owner has the ability to abuse mint functionality, leading to high inflation and potential hacks.
